author: Noel Tominack, UCS Help Desk
subject: Re: Need holes in my Lupin knowledge filled
body:
On Mon, 13 Mar 2000, Luis Cruz wrote:

> > Jigen is an interesting one, in the TV series he uses the phrase "Combat
> > Magnum" which would put it in the Smith & Wesson "K"-frame family.  I
> 
> According to one source, Jigen prefers to use a .38 Double-Action Colt
> Executive.

There is no such model as the Colt Executive, and in one of the movies
they have an extreme close-up of the revolver which plainly shows the
Smith & Wesson Logo.  The quickest way to tell is to find a scene with
Jigen reloading, if he pushes on the latch, its a Smith, if he pulls, its
a Colt.  Oh, that and the direction the cylinder rotates...

> The only weapon Fujiko uses consistently is her body. ;)  Beyond that,
> I haven't seen any listing of her prefered firearm.  She seems to use
> whatever she can concel in her outfit.

I have come to the conclusion that Fujiko uses an FN/Browning Model 1910.
It has a shorter barrel and grip than the 1922 and is easier to conceal.
As for why she had a Nambu in "Cagliostro", well, you got me.  Its simply
a bad choice in sidearms, period.


> I'm no firearms expert, but I believe you are correct that it is a Browning.

I am sort of an expert insofar as I am a Curio and Relic Federal Firearms
Licensee and know the arms of the period.  I am sure its a BAR because it
looks like one.  I am assuming Count Cagliostro's machine gun is an Mg13
becuase of the twin drums and grip.  Though I think the Mg34 may use
them too.


> Overall, I don't think anyone has really gone through each show, special,
> and movie and drawn up a list of the firearms used by each person.

That would be fun!  I wish I had them all to watch through


> If I find out anything else, I'll post it to the FAQ.

Look at all the images of Fujiko with a small pistol, then go to 
http://www.marstar.ca then choose catalogue, pistols, and FN 1910.
Does it look like the one she carries?

Oh, and if you have a clean copy of "Mystery of the Walther P.38" if
you could confirm the markings on Lupin's pistol as AC 41 that would be
cool, when I saw it the chracters were too fuzzy.

Why yes, yes I am trying to build a collection based on anime characters
